feed.title: Seattle Business Review
feed.subtitle: A blog about Seattle businesses and local outstanding talent.

entry.title: Nominations are now open for the SBR 30 under 30 award!

link.title: Nominations are now open for the SBR 30 under 30 award!

entry.content:
The Seattle Business Review is excited to announce that nominations are now open for our annual 30 under 30 award. This prestigious award recognizes the top 30 young professionals under the age of 30 who are making a significant impact in their industry and the local community.

Do you know a colleague who deserves recognition for their hard work and achievements? Now is the time to nominate them for the 30 under 30 award! We are looking for individuals who are innovative, ambitious, and driven, and who are making a positive difference in their field.

To nominate a colleague for the 30 under 30 award, simply visit our website and fill out the nomination form. Be sure to provide detailed information about the nominee and why they are deserving of this award. Nominations will be accepted until January 1st 2023.

Don't miss this opportunity to showcase the talent and achievements of your colleagues! Nominate a deserving individual for the 30 under 30 award today.

Click here to submit a nomination for the 2023 SBR 30 under 30 award!
entry.summary: The Seattle Business Review is excited to announce that nominations are now open for our annual 30 under 30 award. This prestigious award recognizes the top 30 young professionals under the age of 30 who are making a significant impact in their industry and the local community.

entry.title: Small Business Highlight: Project Bionic
entry.content:
Project Bionic is a social media marketing company based out of the Ballard neighborhood in Seattle. Founded in 2016, the company has quickly established itself as a leader in the world of social media marketing, offering a wide range of services to help businesses and organizations increase their online presence and engagement.

One of the key reasons for Project Bionic's success is its team of experienced and talented professionals. The company's founder and CEO, Josh Dirks, has over a decade of experience in the marketing industry, and has assembled a team of experts in various fields, including social media strategy, content creation, and advertising. This wealth of knowledge and expertise allows Project Bionic to provide personalized and effective solutions for its clients.

In addition to its team, Project Bionic also prides itself on its commitment to staying up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in the world of social media. The company regularly attends industry conferences and events, and is always on the lookout for new and innovative ways to help its clients succeed.

Project Bionic offers a wide range of services to its clients, including social media strategy development, content creation, advertising management, and more. The company has worked with a diverse range of clients, including small businesses, non-profits, and large corporations.

Overall, Project Bionic is a leading social media marketing company based in the Ballard neighborhood of Seattle. With its experienced team and commitment to staying at the forefront of the industry, the company is well-positioned to help businesses and organizations succeed in the world of social media.
entry.summary: Project Bionic is a social media marketing company based out of the Ballard neighborhood in Seattle. Founded in 2016, the company has quickly established itself as a leader in the world of social media marketing, offering a wide range of services to help businesses and organizations increase their online presence and engagement.

entry.title: 2022 Fall Small Business Trend Report
entry.content:
Seattle, known for its thriving tech industry and rainy weather, is home to a vibrant small business community. In recent years, several trends have emerged that are shaping the future of small businesses in the city.

One of the biggest trends in Seattle's small business community is the growth of tech-focused companies. The city's proximity to major tech hubs like Silicon Valley and the abundance of talented software developers in the area have made it a hotbed for startups and small businesses in the tech industry.

What's Next?

Another trend that is gaining momentum in Seattle is the rise of socially and environmentally conscious businesses. Many small businesses in the city are embracing sustainability and corporate social responsibility, offering eco-friendly products and services and giving back to the community.

The growth of online commerce has also had a major impact on small businesses in Seattle. More and more customers are turning to the internet to shop, making it essential for small businesses to have an online presence. Many small businesses in the city have embraced e-commerce, either by creating their own online stores or using platforms like Amazon and Etsy to sell their products.

The food and beverage industry is also a major part of Seattle's small business community. The city is home to a thriving coffee scene, with many small coffee shops and roasters offering unique blends and roasts. The craft beer industry is also booming in Seattle, with a growing number of microbreweries and taprooms popping up throughout the city.

Overall, the small business community in Seattle is vibrant and diverse, with a wide range of companies serving the city's residents and visitors. From tech startups to environmentally conscious businesses and the thriving food and beverage industry, Seattle's small businesses are a driving force in the local economy.
entry.summary: Seattle, known for its thriving tech industry and rainy weather, is home to a vibrant small business community. In recent years, several trends have emerged that are shaping the future of small businesses in the city.

entry.title: Small Business Highlight: Intercept Games
entry.content:
Intercept Games is a Seattle-based company that has made a big splash in the gaming world with their hit indie game, "Kerbal Space Program".

Founded in 2011 by a team of experienced game developers, Intercept Games set out to create a space exploration game that was both challenging and fun. After several years of development, "Kerbal Space Program" was released to critical acclaim, receiving numerous awards and accolades for its innovative gameplay and realistic physics engine.

"Kerbal Space Program" tasks players with building and launching their own spacecraft, navigating the dangers of space and completing a variety of missions. The game offers a high degree of realism, with players having to consider factors such as fuel consumption, aerodynamics, and gravitational forces in order to successfully complete their missions.

Despite its complex gameplay, "Kerbal Space Program" has been a commercial success, with a dedicated fan base and a steady stream of updates and expansions. In addition to its popularity among gamers, the game has also been used by NASA and other space agencies as a training and educational tool.

Intercept Games continues to operate out of its Seattle headquarters, working on new projects and updates for "Kerbal Space Program" as well as other upcoming games. The company's success is a testament to the thriving indie game development scene in Seattle, and a reminder of the city's reputation as a hub for innovation and creativity.
entry.summary: Intercept Games is a Seattle-based company that has made a big splash in the gaming world with their hit indie game, "Kerbal Space Program".

entry.title: Small Business Highlight: Xealth
entry.content:
Seattle startup, Xealth, is making waves in the digital health industry with its innovative platform for organizing and deploying digital health tools.

Founded in 2016 by a team of experienced healthcare and technology professionals, Xealth has developed a comprehensive platform that enables health systems to easily integrate and activate digital health tools. The platform is designed to help health systems improve patient outcomes, reduce costs, and streamline operations.

Xealth's platform is unique in its ability to support a wide range of digital health tools, including apps, devices, and services. This allows health systems to easily select and deploy the tools that are most relevant to their patients and clinical needs. In addition, the platform provides robust analytics and reporting capabilities, allowing health systems to track the effectiveness of their digital health initiatives and make data-driven decisions.

The company has already partnered with several major health systems, including Providence St. Joseph Health and the Mayo Clinic. These partnerships have demonstrated the effectiveness of Xealth's platform in improving patient outcomes and reducing costs.

Xealth is continuing to expand its operations, with plans to develop new features and integrations for its platform. The company's success is a testament to the growing importance of digital health solutions and the need for effective platforms to support their deployment and activation.
entry.summary: Seattle startup, Xealth, is making waves in the digital health industry with its innovative platform for organizing and deploying digital health tools.

entry.title: Dinosaurs are extinct today
entry.content:
Never in all their history have men been able truly to conceive of the world as one: a single sphere, a globe, having the qualities of a globe, a round earth in which all the directions eventually meet, in which there is no center because every point, or none, is center — an equal earth which all men occupy as equals. The airman's earth, if free men make it, will be truly round: a globe in practice, not in theory.

Science cuts two ways, of course; its products can be used for both good and evil. But there's no turning back from science. The early warnings about technological dangers also come from science.

What was most significant about the lunar voyage was not that man set foot on the Moon but that they set eye on the earth.

A Chinese tale tells of some men sent to harm a young girl who, upon seeing her beauty, become her protectors rather than her violators. That's how I felt seeing the Earth for the first time. I could not help but love and cherish her.

For those who have seen the Earth from space, and for the hundreds and perhaps thousands more who will, the experience most certainly changes your perspective. The things that we share in our world are far more valuable than those which divide us.

The Final Frontier

There can be no thought of finishing for ‘aiming for the stars.’ Both figuratively and literally, it is a task to occupy the generations. And no matter how much progress one makes, there is always the thrill of just beginning.

There can be no thought of finishing for ‘aiming for the stars.’ Both figuratively and literally, it is a task to occupy the generations. And no matter how much progress one makes, there is always the thrill of just beginning.

The dreams of yesterday are the hopes of today and the reality of tomorrow. Science has not yet mastered prophecy. We predict too much for the next year and yet far too little for the next ten.

Spaceflights cannot be stopped. This is not the work of any one man or even a group of men. It is a historical process which mankind is carrying out in accordance with the natural laws of human development.

Reaching for the Stars

As we got further and further away, it [the Earth] diminished in size. Finally it shrank to the size of a marble, the most beautiful you can imagine. That beautiful, warm, living object looked so fragile, so delicate, that if you touched it with a finger it would crumble and fall apart. Seeing this has to change a man.

To go places and do things that have never been done before – that’s what living is all about.

Space, the final frontier. These are the voyages of the Starship Enterprise. Its five-year mission: to explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life and new civilizations, to boldly go where no man has gone before.

As I stand out here in the wonders of the unknown at Hadley, I sort of realize there’s a fundamental truth to our nature, Man must explore, and this is exploration at its greatest.

Placeholder text by Space Ipsum. Photographs by Unsplash.
entry.summary: Never in all their history have men been able truly to conceive of the world as one: a single sphere, a globe, having the qualities of a globe, a round earth in which all the directions eventually meet, in which there is no center because every point, or none, is center — an equal earth which all men occupy as equals. The airman's earth, if free men make it, will be truly round: a globe in practice, not in theory.
